Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
Orchestrates core Tetris gameplay, translating input events into board updates, managing scoring and level progression, and notifying the UI controller of state changes and game outcomes.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    GameController.Shard
    Particle effect representing a single shard emitted from a cleared block.
    static class 
    GameController.WhiteFlash
    Visual effect representing a brief white flash across a cleared row.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(GuiController c, Board b)
      Constructs a game controller bound to a specific UI controller and board implementation.
      Parameters:
      c - the GuiController responsible for rendering and input
      b - the Board implementation that maintains game state

  • Method Details

    • initGame

      public void initGame()
      Initializes a standard endless game session, creating the first brick, binding score updates, and preparing the view.

    • initLevelGame

      public void initLevelGame()
      Initializes level-based gameplay starting from the first level.

    • initLevelGame

      public void initLevelGame(int levelId)
      Initializes level-based gameplay for a specific level identifier, binding level progress information to the UI.
      Parameters:
      levelId - identifier of the level configuration to load

    • onDownEvent

      public DownData onDownEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles a request to move the active brick down, updating the board, resolving merges, scoring, level progression, and visual effects.
      Specified by:
      onDownEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the move event describing the source of the down action
      Returns:
      a DownData bundle containing clear-row information, view updates, and any score bonus applied

    • onLeftEvent

      public ViewData onLeftEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles a request to move the active brick left and returns updated view data for rendering.
      Specified by:
      onLeftEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the move event describing the source of the action
      Returns:
      updated ViewData after applying the move

    • onRightEvent

      public ViewData onRightEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles a request to move the active brick right and returns updated view data for rendering.
      Specified by:
      onRightEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the move event describing the source of the action
      Returns:
      updated ViewData after applying the move

    • onRotateEvent

      public ViewData onRotateEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles a request to rotate the active brick and returns updated view data for rendering.
      Specified by:
      onRotateEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the move event describing the source of the action
      Returns:
      updated ViewData after applying the rotation

    • createNewGame

      public void createNewGame()
      Resets the underlying board to start a new game and clears any level-specific progress tracking.
      Specified by:
      createNewGame in interface InputEventListener

    • getLevelManager

      public LevelManager getLevelManager()
      Returns the level manager used for level-based gameplay.
      Returns:
      the current LevelManager, or null if not in level mode

    • isLevelMode

      public boolean isLevelMode()
      Indicates whether the controller is currently running in level mode.
      Returns:
      true if level mode is active, false otherwise

    • getSpeedDelay

      public int getSpeedDelay()
      Returns the current drop delay in milliseconds, either derived from the active level configuration or a default value when not in level mode.
      Returns:
      the drop delay used by the game loop

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Exposes the underlying board used by the controller.
      Returns:
      the active Board instance

    • triggerShatter

      public void triggerShatter(int gridY, int[][] boardBeforeClear)
      Spawns particle effects for a cleared row using a snapshot of the board state before the clear operation.
      Parameters:
      gridY - the index of the cleared row in the board matrix
      boardBeforeClear - a snapshot of the board prior to row removal

    • getActiveShards

      public List<GameController.Shard> getActiveShards()
      Returns the collection of currently active shard particles.
      Returns:
      list of active GameController.Shard instances

    • getActiveFlashes

      public List<GameController.WhiteFlash> getActiveFlashes()
      Returns the collection of currently active white flash effects.
      Returns:
      list of active GameController.WhiteFlash instances

    • updateFlashes

      public void updateFlashes(double deltaTime)
      Advances all flash effects by the specified time step, removing any that have completed.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - time elapsed since the last update in seconds

    • updateShards

      public void updateShards(double deltaTime)
      Advances all shard particles by the specified time step, removing any that have completed.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - time elapsed since the last update in seconds

    • clearAllShards

      public void clearAllShards()
      Clears all currently active shard and flash effects.
